meanings.definition: To commit or give in trust
meanings.sent1: She decided to intrust her savings to the bank for safekeeping.
meanings.sent2: He chose to intrust the important documents to his lawyer.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel intrusted its acorns to a secret hiding spot in the tree.
meanings.sent4: The teacher intrusted the students with the responsibility of caring for the class pet.
meanings.sent5: Intrusting your secrets to a loyal friend can bring great relief.

meanings.sent1: The courier was instructed to intrust the package to the recipient only.
meanings.sent2: The company intrusted the task of delivering the goods to a reliable shipping service.
meanings.sent3: The magician intrusted his magic wand to his assistant for safekeeping.
meanings.sent4: She intrusted her heart to him, hoping he would handle it with care.
meanings.sent5: Intrusting the key to the treasure chest to the pirate captain was a risky move.

meanings.sent1: The lawyer advised his client to intrust the property to a trustee.
meanings.sent2: The parents decided to intrust the family heirloom to their eldest child.
meanings.sent3: The explorer intrusted the map to the ancient treasure to his loyal companion.
meanings.sent4: She intrusted her dreams and aspirations to the guidance of her mentor.
meanings.sent5: Intrusting the future of the kingdom to a young prince was a bold decision.
